Item.Name: Alton Towers Hotel
Item.Summary: This unique hotel is themed around the incredible explorer Sir Algenon, who has made the Alton Towers Hotel his home. There are plenty of fun and quirky features to discover, including his amazing flying ship which has crash-landed right in the middle of the hotel.

Item.Name: Alton Towers Spa
Item.Summary: Step inside and escape to a blissful oasis of luxurious tranquillity, nestled inside the beautiful grounds of the Alton Towers Resort.

Item.Name: Alton Towers Waterpark
Item.Summary: There's no end to the fun you can have in the Alton Towers Waterpark. You can unwind in Lagoona Bay or the Lazy River and let all your stresses float away, or enjoy some adrenaline thrilled adventure on the Master Blaster Water Coaster, sending you speeding round the Waterpark at exhilarating speeds.

Item.Name: Battle Galleons
Item.Summary:
Sail amidst shark infested waters to the pirate cove!

A marvellous spectacle for land lubbers and pirate crew, Battle Galleons is an interactive water ride which swashes the buckle for all ages.

Please be aware this ride closes at dusk.
Item.Keywords: battle galleons, pirates, splash, ships, water, water guns

Bing and Flop are having an exciting day out at Alton Towers Resort!  Join them as they stop off in Big Fun Showtime to have their picnic, play games and make some new friends.

Item.Name: Choragic Monument
Item.Summary:
Erected by the 16th Earl of Shrewsbury in memory of his uncle, Charles Talbot, the 15th Earl, who transformed the gardens from a barren wasteland, inhabited only by rabbits, into the magnificent gardens we see today and “made the desert smile”.  

The box hedge at the foot of the monument is in the shape of the letter “S”. Originally, the area surrounding the “S”, now covered in gravel, would have been filled with “grog” – a by-product of the pottery industry.

Item.Name: Le Refuge & Bath Fountain
Item.Summary:
In the mid-1800s it was considered beneficial to the health to take cold baths throughout the year. 

A Coadstone statue of a triton blowing into a conch shell originally topped the fountain.  

To the right of the Bath Fountain is Le Refuge – with a chimney vent on one side of the door and an air-vent on the other – which was used before and after the bath.

Item.Name: Pagoda Fountain
Item.Summary:
The recently completed restoration of the Grade II* Listed (Chinese) Pagoda Fountain at Alton Towers Resort, Staffordshire. The 3-month restoration involved specialist surface blasting, iron work restoration and painting. 
The (Chinese) Pagoda Fountain was completed c. 1832, designed by Robert Abraham. The cast-iron structure was modelled on the To-ho pagoda in Canton, Southern China and made by the Coalbrookedale Iron Company.

Item.Summary:

Item.Name: The Conservatories
Item.Summary:
The Conservatories were completed in 1824, the garden Conservatory has seven glazed domes, and pineapple finials.  The central dome is topped by an earl’s coronet.   

In 1834 the 16th Earl managed to grow bananas (in those days considered an exotic fruit) at Alton and sent one to the Duke of Devonshire at Chatsworth together with detailed instructions on how to eat it!

Item.Name: The Crooked Spoon
Item.Summary: Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served in this quirky restaurant with a delicious yet unusual menu on offer. Keep an eye out for the mischievous little folk, as rare glimpses have been caught on camera and displayed on the gallery walls… Watch very carefully as they may not be quite as they seem! In the evening, sit back and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere.

Item.Name: The Furchester Hotel Live Show
Item.Summary:
A brand new live and interactive show, where you can join Phoebe, Funella, Furgus, Elmo and Cookie Monster at The Furchester Hotel.
Make your way through the famous revolving doors before being welcomed with furry arms into the hotel.

The show sees the hotel prepare for the exciting arrival of Chick Swagger, you can sing and dance along to the rock-a-doodle-do hit, Tail Feather Shake.

Item.Name: The Skyride (Forbidden Valley)
Item.Summary:
Guests (6+) are required to wear a suitable, secured face mask If you do not have a mask, they are available to purchase from our retail outlets. Any guests without a valid exemption will not be permitted to ride without a mask.

Up in the clouds, float hundreds of feet up in gondolas all the colours of the rainbow. Find your jaw dropping to the floor at the sights over Alton Towers and beyond.

Item.Name: The Smiler
Item.Summary:
Guests (11+) are required to wear a suitable, secured face mask If you do not have a mask, they are available to purchase from our retail outlets. Any guests without a valid exemption will not be permitted to ride without a mask.

The Smiler is the world’s first 14-loop rollercoaster. Its twisting track combines the world beating 14 loops with a speed of 85 km/h and a track length 3x longer than Oblivion!
Item.RestrictionSummary:
Guests who would find it difficult to exit the ride without assistance, in the unlikely event of an evacuation, will need to be accompanied by a member of their group. Group members providing assistance need to be over the age of 14.

This ride has separate access for Standard Passes, Fastrack Passes, Ride Access Passes and wheelchair users.

The minimum standing height restriction is 1.4m.

The maximum chest size restriction is 56cm.

This ride includes rigorous motion and / or velocity and is therefore not recommended for guests with back, heart or neck conditions.

This ride includes rigorous motion and / or velocity and is therefore not recommended for expectant mothers.

In the unlikely event of an evacuation, the process may include climbing ladders, walking over narrow balconies and being strapped into a harness . For this reason it is not suitable for all guests.

In the unlikely event of an evacuation, the evacuation process requires guests to walk 25 m + independently.

Wheelchair users must be able to transfer from their own chair into the ride vehicle without assistance.

In the unlikely event of an evacuation, the process may include climbing ladders, walking over narrow balconies and being strapped into a harness. For this reason it is not suitable for all guests.

For safety reasons, due to the speed and motion of this ride guests must be able to keep their head upright without assistance.

Due to the speed and motion of this ride guests must be able to brace themselves with their feet and remain sitting up right.

Due to the speed and motion of this ride guests must be able to brace themselves with their hands and / or feet and remain sitting upright. Guests also need to be able to exit the ride independently / with assistance from a member of their group, in the unlikely event of an evacuation.

Guests who have a plaster cast or brace should seek medical advice before choosing to ride. If guests choose to ride they should check they can meet the rides safety requirements.

The ride has strong magnetic fields and is therefore not suitable for guests with implantable cardioverter defibrillators (ICDs) or pacemakers.

This ride includes flashing lights and smoke/mist/fog effects and as a result may not be suitable for all guests.

Item.Name: The Towers
Item.Summary: Founded on the site of an Iron Age camp, there were actually many different buildings before the existing Towers, but from 1412 until 1924 they all belonged to the same family - the Talbots (Earls of Shrewsbury).

Offer.Title: The Alton Towers Dungeon
Offer.Summary: Laugh & Scream for only £2.50 exclusively during Services Day
Offer.Description:
The Alton Towers Dungeons is an interactive journey through Staffordshire’s darkest history, guaranteed to make you laugh and scream in equal measure.

This 45 minute experience journeys through 5 hands on shows, a boat ride* and 6 themed areas. From the frantically funny to the seriously spooky, each show will introduce you to a real historical person from a key moment in Staffordshire’s history.

Recommended for ages 10+, reserve your time at the Alton Towers Dungeon which is located next to the Dark Forest behind the Tower Ruins.
